(['explosion/srsly', 'Name already in use', 'srsly: Modern high-performance serialization utilities for Python'], ['
        ', ' Modern high-performance serialization utilities for Python (JSON, MessagePack, Pickle)
      ', '
        Use Git or checkout with SVN using the web URL.
    ', '
      Work fast with our official CLI.
      ', '.
    ', '

                to use Codespaces.

    If nothing happens, ', ' and try again.
  ', '
    If nothing happens, ', ' and try again.
  ', '
    If nothing happens, ', ' and try again.
  ', 'Your codespace will open once ready.', 'There was a problem preparing your codespace, please try again.', "This package bundles some of the best Python serialization libraries into one
standalone package, with a high-level API that makes it easy to write code
that's correct across platforms and Pythons. This allows us to provide all the
serialization utilities we need in a single binary wheel. Currently supports ", ', ', ', ', ', ', ' and ', '.', '
', '
', '
', '
', 'Serialization is hard, especially across Python versions and multiple platforms.
After dealing with many subtle bugs over the years (encodings, locales, large
files) our libraries like ', ' and
', ' had steadily grown a number of utility functions to
wrap the multiple serialization formats we need to support (especially ', ',
', ' and ', '). These wrapping functions ended up duplicated across our
codebases, so we wanted to put them in one place.', "At the same time, we noticed that having a lot of small dependencies was making
maintenance harder, and making installation slower. To solve this, we've made
", ' standalone, by including the component packages directly within it. This
way we can provide all the serialization utilities we need in a single binary
wheel.', ' currently includes forks of the following packages:', ' Note that ', ' is only compatible with ', '. For 2.7+ compatibility, use ', '.', ' can be installed from pip. Before installing, make sure that your ', ',
', ' and ', ' are up to date.', 'Or from conda via conda-forge:', "Alternatively, you can also compile the library from source. You'll need to make
sure that you have a development environment with a Python distribution
including header files, a compiler (XCode command-line tools on macOS / OS X or
Visual C++ build tools on Windows), pip and git installed.", 'Install from source:', 'For developers, install requirements separately and then install in editable
mode without build isolation:', ' The underlying module is exposed via ', '. However, we normally
interact with it via the utility functions only.', 'Serialize an object to a JSON string. Falls back to ', ' if ', " is used (until it's fixed in ", ').', 'Deserialize unicode or bytes to a Python object.', 'Create a JSON file and dump contents or write to standard output.', 'Load JSON from a file or standard input.', 'Create a gzipped JSON file and dump contents.', 'Create a gzipped JSONL file and dump contents.', 'Load gzipped JSON from a file.', 'Load gzipped JSONL from a file.', 'Create a JSONL file (newline-delimited JSON) and dump contents line by line, or
write to standard output.', 'Read a JSONL file (newline-delimited JSON) or from JSONL data from standard
input and yield contents line by line. Blank lines will always be skipped.', 'Check if a Python object is JSON-serializable.', ' The underlying module is exposed via ', '. However, we normally
interact with it via the utility functions only.', 'Serialize an object to a msgpack byte string.', 'Deserialize msgpack bytes to a Python object.', 'Create a msgpack file and dump contents.', 'Load a msgpack file.', ' The underlying module is exposed via ', '. However, we
normally interact with it via the utility functions only.', 'Serialize a Python object with pickle.', 'Deserialize bytes with pickle.', ' The underlying module is exposed via ', '. However, we normally
interact with it via the utility functions only.', 'Serialize an object to a YAML string. See the ', ' for details on the indentation format.', 'Deserialize unicode or a file object to a Python object.', 'Create a YAML file and dump contents or write to standard output.', 'Load YAML from a file or standard input.', 'Check if a Python object is YAML-serializable.', '
